content:
by  Josh LinehanPublished  November  

After a ninemonth . million investigation into allegations of academic fraud the full report will be released and University President Mark Yudof will outline his action plan today PERIOD
Yudof who has already suspended the mens basketball team from postseason play is expected to announce further sanctions including structural changes that might leave McKinley Boston vice president of student development and athletics and mens athletics director Mark Dienhart unemployed PERIOD
The report and accompanying exhibits totaling at least  pages with testimony from more than  people will be made public at a  p.m PERIOD press conference in the Basic Sciences and Biomedical Engineering Building PERIOD
Mens coaches and athletes plan to meet outside Morrill Hall this morning to visually show support for Dienhart PERIOD Wrestling coach J Robinson said he will appear but said the activity is optional for the athletes PERIOD
Yudof also received a letter Oct PERIOD  in support for Dienhart  as well as Jeff Schemmel senior associate director and NCCA compliance officer Chris Schoemann  signed by every coach in the mens athletic department PERIOD The letter did not mention Boston PERIOD
The steering committee of the Twin Cities Assembly a studentfaculty governing body unanimously recommended eliminating Bostons position Nov PERIOD  as well as strictly regulating conversations between coaches and faculty PERIOD The recommendations were subsequently passed on to Yudof PERIOD
Racial tensions surround the possibility of Boston leaving the University PERIOD Since the investigation began Clem Haskins Alonzo Newby and Rufus Simmons have all left under duress all three are black PERIOD
The Board of Regents met Thursday behind closed doors to discuss the investigation but declined to comment until after the report is made public PERIOD
The investigation began in March after former tutor Jan Gangelhoff said she wrote more than  papers between  and  for members of the Gophers mens basketball team PERIOD
The investigation was expanded in May to delve into allegations University mens athletics officials improperly intervened in sexualmisconduct cases PERIOD
The Minnesota Daily will offer updated online coverage of breaking news throughout the day including the full text of the reports conclusion PERIOD Also a Daily Extra edition will be distributed Saturday morning PERIOD

 Staff Reporter Thomas Douty contributed to this report PERIOD

Josh Linehan welcomes comments at jemailprotected PERIOD He can also be reached at   x3212 PERIOD
